comments.author: reviewer1
comments.body: SQL injection vulnerability here - you're concatenating user input directly into the query string. Use parameterized queries with ? placeholders instead.

comments.author: reviewer2
comments.body: Missing error handling - this async operation should be wrapped in try-catch.

comments.author: reviewer1
comments.body: This LIKE query is vulnerable to SQL injection. The search term should be parameterized, not concatenated.

comments.author: reviewer3
comments.body: Missing key prop in this React list. Each child in a list should have a unique 'key' prop.

comments.author: reviewer2
comments.body: You're using bcrypt.hashSync which blocks the event loop. Use bcrypt.hash (async) instead with at least 10 salt rounds.

comments.author: reviewer1
comments.body: Add rate limiting to this login endpoint - it's vulnerable to brute force attacks. Suggest 5 attempts per 15 minutes.

comments.author: reviewer3
comments.body: React key warning - you're using array index as key which can cause issues. Use the user ID instead.

comments.author: reviewer2
comments.body: No error handling on this API call. Wrap in try-catch and show user-friendly error message.

comments.author: reviewer1
comments.body: SQL injection in the IN clause - you're joining the IDs directly. Use placeholders: const placeholders = ids.map(() => '?').join(',');

comments.author: reviewer3
comments.body: Need try-catch around this database operation.

comments.author: reviewer2
comments.body: Using bcryptSync here - switch to async bcrypt.hash to avoid blocking. Also make sure you're using at least 10 rounds.

comments.author: reviewer1
comments.body: Password reset endpoint needs rate limiting to prevent abuse. Limit to 3 attempts per hour.

comments.author: reviewer1
comments.body: Dynamic ORDER BY with string concatenation is a SQL injection risk. Whitelist the allowed column names instead.

comments.author: reviewer3
comments.body: Missing key prop on these tag elements. Use tag.id as the key.
